text.p: Schering-Plough Corp said on Monday it agreed to acquire Mallinckrodt Inc's animal-health business for $405 million in cash.
Schering-Plough said the acquisition of Mallinckrodt Veterinary Inc should not be dilutive to 1997 earnings and should have a positive effect in 1998 and beyond.

Mallinckrodt Veterinary had 1996 sales of $456 million. Its leading products include Ralgro, a growth-promotant implant; the parasiticides Levasole and Tramisol; and Estrumate and Planate, prostaglandin reproductive hormones.

Schering-Plough will integrate the newly acquired unit into Schering-Plough Animal Health. This subsidiary had 1996 sales of $196 million, competing primarily in the anti-infectives and biologicals segments.
Schering-Plough Corp makes pharmaceutical and health-care products.
Mallinckrodt, based in St. Louis, makes health-care and specialty-chemical products.
